boat.full_description:
Diric takes her name from her first owners Richard and Diane, who lived in Yarmouth IoW. She is built of the best materials (carvel round bilge mahogany on oak, lead keel, canvas covered decks).

After World War II Diric was sold to Col. Mitchell, who lived near Yarmouth, and taught Sea Scouts to sail. She was sold in the 1970s to John Sleight and then transferred to his brother Colin in the 1990s.

In 1998 she was bought by Steve Pavey who changed her name to Diane and replaced her Stuart Turner with a Britt engine

Bought by Nick and Jill Bredon in 2008, who undertook an extensive refit/rebuild at the Classic Boat Museaum, Newport IoW. In 2010, she was winner of the YOGAFF Concourse d'Elegance. Her current owner returned her to her original name, and had Nick Gates of Emsworth, give Diric, an extensive refit costing some £24,000, including all the varnished brightwork on the cabin and coamings around the large cockpit.

Diric has a comfortable and cosy 2 berth cabin with fitted heads. She has no electronics currently but there are places for echo, vhf and an electronic log. Yanmar GM10 engine. Very capable, fully equipped and ready to sail, Diric has been kept ashore in the winter months and has her own craddle/props. Well cared for in family ownership.

Lying Hayling Island  Sailing Club moorings, Chichester Harbour
